item.title: Space Navigator
item.description: TL; DR A system for calculating optimal collision avoidance maneuvers for satellites based on reinforcement learning. About We made Space Navigator - a system for automatically determining the probability of collision of space objects and calculating the most effective evasive maneuver using AI. Stage of the project: Research Article “Space Navigator: a Tool for the Optimization of Collision Avoidance Maneuvers” (2020) MVP (2019) First place in the competition of projects of the Academy of Roscosmos (presentation slides, 2018) VR presentation (2018) Demonstrations and reports:

item.title: Satellite Positioning
item.description: TL; DR Improving the prediction of the position of a space object using machine learning. About The project task â€“ build a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. https://www.esa.int/Applications/Telecommunications_Integrated_Applications/Orbits Predicting the position of satellites is one of the most important tasks in astronomy. For example, information on the exact position of satellites in orbit is necessary to avoid extremely dangerous satellite collisions. Each collision leads not only to satellites destruction, but also to occurrence of thousands of pieces of space debris pieces.

item.title: Task creation: IDAO (HSE University ML Olympiad)
item.description: TL; DR Preparing the task for the IDAO 2020 Data Analysis Olympiad based on the Satellite Positioning project. About This year the online task is coming from astronomy. It is focused on building a model that would predict the position of space objects using simulation data. The task was given by Russian Astronomical Science Center (ASC) and adopted for the Olympiad by the Laboratory of Methods for Big Data Analysis (LAMBDA, HSE University).
